1.verse: Greeting - From Paul, who is a prisoner for the cause of Christ Jesus, and our brother Timothy. To Philemon our dearly loved coworker,

2.verse: Apphia our sister, Archippus our fellow soldier, and the church that meets in your house.

3.verse: May the grace and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

4.verse: Paul’s prayer for Philemon - Philemon, I thank my God every time I mention you in my prayers

5.verse: because I’ve heard of your love and faithfulness, which you have both for the Lord Jesus and for all God’s people.

6.verse: I pray that your partnership in the faith might become effective by an understanding of all that is good among us in Christ.

7.verse: I have great joy and encouragement because of your love, since the hearts of God’s people are refreshed by your actions, my brother.

8.verse: Paul’s appeal for Onesimus - Therefore, though I have enough confidence in Christ to command you to do the right thing,

9.verse: I would rather appeal to you through love. I, Paul—an old man, and now also a prisoner for Christ Jesus—

10.verse: appeal to you for my child Onesimus. I became his father in the faith during my time in prison.

11.verse: He was useless to you before, but now he is useful to both of us.

12.verse: I’m sending him back to you, which is like sending you my own heart.

13.verse: I considered keeping him with me so that he might serve me in your place during my time in prison because of the gospel.

14.verse: However, I didn’t want to do anything without your consent so that your act of kindness would occur willingly and not under pressure.

15.verse: Maybe this is the reason that Onesimus was separated from you for a while so that you might have him back forever—

16.verse: no longer as a slave but more than a slave—that is, as a dearly loved brother. He is especially a dearly loved brother to me. How much more can he become a brother to you, personally and spiritually in the Lord!

17.verse: So, if you really consider me a partner, welcome Onesimus as if you were welcoming me.

18.verse: If he has harmed you in any way or owes you money, charge it to my account.

19.verse: I, Paul, will pay it back to you (I’m writing this with my own hand). Of course, I won’t mention that you owe me your life.

20.verse: Yes, brother, I want this favor from you in the Lord! Refresh my heart in Christ.

21.verse: I’m writing to you, confident of your obedience and knowing that you will do more than what I ask.

22.verse: Also, one more thing—prepare a guest room for me. I hope that I will be released from prison to be with you because of your prayers.

23.verse: Final greeting - Epaphras, who is in prison with me for the cause of Christ Jesus, greets you,

24.verse: as well as my coworkers Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke.

25.verse: May the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit.
